reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports by 30 May 2004, and every 12 months thereafter
summary:
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Liberia and West Africa,
 Takes note of reports by the UN Panel of Experts on Liberia,
 Expressing concern at breaches of measures imposed by resolution 1343 (2001),
 Welcoming the Comprehensive Peace Agreement and the National Transitional Government of Liberia,

1. Terminates prohibitions imposed by resolutions 1343 (2001) and 1478 (2003) and dissolves the related committee.

2. Imposes new measures:
   (a) Prevent sale or supply of arms and related materiel to Liberia.
   (b) Prevent provision of technical training or assistance related to arms.
   (c) Applies to all sales or supply of arms to any recipient in Liberia, including non-State actors.
   (d) Exempts supplies for UNMIL.
   (e) Exempts supplies for an international training and reform programme for Liberian armed forces and police, approved by the Committee.
   (f) Exempts non-lethal military equipment for humanitarian or protective use, approved by the Committee.
   (g) Affirms protective clothing is exempt.
